Definition: In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated by <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words. PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head is used for the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No".
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Physical Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The basket is used for carrying the laundry.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX always wore<sep>Tail: hangs item up
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, the Head is not something that can be used for hanging items. So the output should be "No".

Positive Examples.input: Head: floor mats<sep>Tail: wipe off one's boots
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, the Head is used for the Tail. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX accepts god 's ___<sep>Tail: to continue to follow God
Negative Examples.explanation: In this example, the Head is not something that can be used to continue to follow God. So the output should be "No".
The credentials  can be used for proving something, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX accepts the job<sep>Tail: joyful
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to show<sep>Tail: to go to PersonY
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to say<sep>Tail: celebrate
Head: PersonX answers PersonY question<sep>Tail: smiles
